text:
49 year old female with DM, HTN, CAD s/p 5-vessel CABG and PCI,
   presented with L leg erythema/pain/swelling, fever, nausea/vomiting
   since Wednesday.  In the ED she had a temp to 102.1 with rigors (was
   given Motrin and tylenol) and was started on Vanc/Zosyn for presumptive
   LLE cellulitis and admitted to medicine. Labs pertinent for CBC with
   left shift, [**Last Name (un) **], hyponatremia and elevated lactate. Blood cultures grew
   out STAPH AUREUS COAG + (MSSA) (4/4 bottles).  Hospital course
   complicated by hypotension/Sepsis/ATN.  Pt transferred to MICU for
   management of sepsis on.  Additionally, overnight patient developed RUE
   "clumsiness" concerning for acute stroke, neurology was consulted and
   MRI was negative for acute stroke.
   Vascular surgery and podiatry were consulted for LLE management.
   Vascular feel diabetic soft tissue infection and recommend IV
   antibiotics. Podiatry feel acute charcot foot with overlying
   cellulitis. They recommended betadine dressing to blister with dsd/ace
   wrap daily, NWB and leg elevation
   Sepsis without organ dysfunction
   Assessment:
   Tmax 99.5, WBC 10.2 Lactate this AM.  Off pressors since last evening.
   [**3-29**] blood culture bottles + for MSSA
   Action:
   Currently on Zoysn, PICC line to be placed.  On ATC tylenol
   Response:
   No recent temp spikes
   Plan:
   Daily survelance cultures, ANBX as ordered
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   BUN 52 down from 54 Creat 4.0 (up from 3.7).  Phos up to 5.4  UOP 40-60
   cc/hr clear yellow.   Renal US negative for hydronephrosis.
   Action:
   Currently on IVF at 100 cc/hr.  Lytes due at 1500.  Urine lytes sent
   this AM, placed on renal diet
   Response:
   UOP increasing.
   Plan:
   Monitor urine output.  Bolus with IVF PRN for low UOP.  [**Hospital1 **] lytes
   Impaired Skin Integrity/left lower extremity infection
   Assessment:
   Pt with open blister to LLE.  Ace
   Action:
   Being followed by vascular & podiatry.  DRSG [**Name5 (PTitle) 917**] this AM by
   podiatry.  ANBX given
   Response:
   Plan:
   NWB to LLE, Ace wrap to extremitie.  For Ct of extremity this AM.
